string-array.name: header_string
string-array.item: AGP
BIOS
CPU
DDR
DIMM
DRAM
DVI
ECC
GPU
HDD
HDTV
IDE
ISA

string-array.name: child_string
string-array.item: Accelerated Graphics Port. A type of video interface introduced in 1996 as an improvement to PCI. It has now been largely replaced by PCI-e.
Basic Input-Output Service. This information is stored on a chip commonly referred to as the CMOS chip\, which really isn\'t a CMOS chip at all.
Compact Disc. A type of optical media\, so called because it uses light to read the data stored on the disk.
The Central Processing Unit\, Microprocessor\, or simply Processor.
Double Data Rate. A type of memory that sends and receives data twice every clock cycle\, and therefore is capable of twice the data transfer rate of standard SDRAM.
Dual In-Line Memory Module. A type of memory chip that uses a 64-bit bus, as compared to SIMM chips\, which used a 32-bit bus.
Dynamic Random Access Memory. A type of RAM that stores each bit of data on separate capacitors.
Digital Video. A protocol for the storage and transfer of audio-visual information\, often used to transfer information from a camcorder to a computer\, usually over a Firewire interface.
Digital Video Interface. A type of digital video interface that can be used by computers and other video devices. It was an improvement over VGA\, but is starting to be obsolesced by HDMI.
Error Correction Code. ECC Memory uses a parity bit to insure that data has been transmitted correctly. It is both slower and more expensive than non-ECC memory\, but it\'s more reliable
Graphics Processing Unit. The chip on a video card that processes graphics and video. Sometimes integrated on the motherboard\, and sometimes on the CPU itself.
Hard Disk Drive. An array of magnetic disks that store data until it is intentionally deleted by the user\, the system, or a program.

High-Definition Television. The over-the-air television standard that replaced NTSC in the United States. Tuners are available that allow HDTV signals to be captured and processed on a computer\, enabling the user to watch TV on his or her computer.
Integrated Device Electronics. See EIDE above.
Industry Standard Architecture. An obsolete expansion interface\, which began to be replaced by PCI and AGP in the mid-1990\'s.
